intro: Rinorea quangtriensis, commonly known as the Quang Tri Rinorea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
